isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3600, 3800, 4000FBC - CAB ACCESSORIES - OPERATION

svcsubproc.title: Horn Circuitry
svcsubproc.para: Power is applied by body builder feed stud (J1) to circuit 14A, fuse F3, and circuit 85 to the coil of horn relay (61). When the horn button is depressed, power flows through the horn relay coil and through circuit 85A, connector (222), circuit 85A, connector (N/L), circuit 85A, slip ring (J3), circuit 85A, the horn button switch, and circuit 85-GB to the steering column ground.

With the horn relay energized, power flows from circuit 85 through circuit 85B, horn relay (61) N.O. contacts, circuit 85C, dash connector (2), circuit 85C, front end connector (425M), circuit 85C, connector (605), and circuit 85B to a splice. From the splice, power flows through circuit 85D to the low note horn, and 85C to the high note horn. A ground path is provided by the starter ground through circuit 11-GJ/11-GB, connector (425M), circuit 11-GB/85-G, connector (605), and circuit 85-G to a splice. From the splice, the high note electric horn is grounded through circuit 85-GA, and the low note electric horn is grounded through circuit 85-GB.

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signal Circuitry
svcsubproc.para: Power is applied by body builder feed stud (J1) to circuit 14A, fuse C3, circuit 55, flasher (1), and circuit 55A/60, to circuits 55A and 60 (with tilt steering column) or to circuit 60 (with stationary column) of turn signal switch (193). When the turn signal switch is moved to the left turn position, the switch contacts close and power is applied to circuit 56, connector (193), and circuit 56 to dash connector (2). From connector (2) power is supplied to circuit 56A, connector (413) [(526) w/3600], and circuit 56A to left front turn light (503). The ground path is circuit 11-GD/11-GC/11-GB, connector (425) [(526) w/3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GJ w/3600) to starter ground. From connector (2), power is also supplied by circuit 56 to circuit 56C and connector (27) to the left turn signal indicator (at instrument cluster). The ground path for the left turn signal indicator is conn. (27), and circuit 28-GB/11-G to cab ground.

When the turn signal switch is moved to the left turn position, the switch contacts close and power is also applied to circuit 56A, connector (193), and circuit 56D to the body builder connector (194).
When the turn signal switch is moved to the right turn position, the switch contacts close and power is applied to circuit 57, connector (193), and circuit 57 to dash connector (2).

From conn. (2) power is supplied to circuit 57A, front end conn. (413) [(526) w/3600], and circuit 57A to right front turn light (505). The ground path is circuit 11-GF/11-GE/11-GB, connector (425) [(526) w/3600], and circuit 11-GB, and 11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GJ w/3600) to starter ground. From connector (2) power is also supplied by circuit 57 to circuit 57C and connector (27) to the right turn signal indicator (at instrument cluster). The ground path for the right turn signal indicator is connector (27), and circuit 28-GB/11-G to cab ground.

When the turn signal switch is moved to the right turn position, the switch contacts close and power is also applied to circuit 57A, connector (193), and circuit 57D to the body builder connector (194).

svcsubproc.title: Turn Signal Circuitry With Dual Face Lights
svcsubproc.para: Power is applied by body builder feed stud (J1) to circuit 14A, fuse C3, circuit 55, flasher (1), and circuit 55A/60, to circuits 55A and 60 (with tilt steering column) or to circuit 60 (with stationary column) of turn signal switch (193). When the turn signal switch is moved to the left turn position, the switch contacts close and power is applied to circuit 56, connector (193), and circuit 56 to dash connector (2). From connector (2) power is supplied to circuit 56A, front end connector (413) [(526) w/3600], and circuit 56 to a splice. From the splice, power is supplied to circuit 56A and the left front turn light (503), and circuit 56F to the left dual face turn light (508). The ground path for the left front turn light is circuit 11-GD/11-GC/11-GB, connector (425) [(526) w/3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GJ w/3600) to starter ground. The ground path for the left front dual face turn light is circuit 11-GG/11-GB, connector (425) [(526) w/3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GJ w/3600) to starter ground.

From connector (2), power is also supplied by circuit 56 to circuit 56C and connector (27) to the left turn signal indicator (at instrument cluster). The ground path for the left turn signal indicator is connector (27), and circuit 28-GB/11-G to cab ground.

When the turn signal switch is moved to the left turn position, the switch contacts close and power is also applied to circuit 56A, connector (193), and circuit 56D to the body builder connector (194).

When the turn signal switch is moved to the right turn position, the switch contacts close and power is applied to circuit 57, connector (193), and circuit 57 to dash connector (2). From connector (2) power is supplied to circuit 57A, and front end connector (413) [(526) w/3600]. From connector (413) or (526) power is supplied to circuit 57 and a splice. From the splice, power is supplied to circuit 57A and the right front turn light (505), and circuit 57F and the right dual face light (509). The ground path for the right front turn light is circuit 11-GF/11-GE/11-GB, connector (425) [(526) w/3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GJ w/3600) to starter ground. The ground path for the right front dual face turn light is circuit 11-GH/11-GB, connector (425) [(526) w/3600], and circuit 11-GB/11-GJ (circuit 11-GG/11-GB/11-GT w/3600) to starter ground.

Power is also supplied by circuit 57 to circuit 57C and connector (27) to the right turn signal indicator (at instrument cluster). The ground path for the right turn signal indicator is conn. (27) and circuit 28-GB/11-G to cab ground.

When the turn signal switch is moved to the right turn position, the switch contacts close and power is also applied to circuit 57A, connector (193), and circuit 57D to the body builder connector (194).
